1.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to murmur (in pleasure or anger); by implication, to ponder
emptiness; figuratively, a worthless thing; adverbially, in vain

2.brief: to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
probably to be heavy, i.e. (figuratively) honorable
to set (literally or figuratively); intensively, to found; reflexively, to sit down together, i.e. settle, consult
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah

3.brief: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, chastisement, i.e. (by implication) a halter; figuratively, restraint
to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
something intwined, i.e. a string, wreath or foliage

4.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
to deride; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to speak unintelligibly

5.brief: at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously

6.brief: to pour out, especially a libation, or to cast (metal); by analogy, to anoint aking
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

7.brief: properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
near, with or among; often in general, to
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage

8.brief: to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
something seized, i.e. a possession (especially of land)
cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

9.brief: properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
iron (as cutting); by extension, an iron implement
something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)
to mould into a form; especially as apotter; figuratively, to determine (i.e. form a resolution)
to dash to pieces, or scatter

10.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent
to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

11.brief: to work (in any sense); by implication, to serve, till, (causatively) enslave, etc.
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear

12.brief: to kiss, literally or figuratively (touch); also (as a mode of attachment), to equip with weapons
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to breathe hard, i.e. be enraged
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
a little or few (often adverbial or compar.)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in
